channel.title: Opening NAT
channel.description:
This is basically for Xbox Live- It all works fine, except connecting to other people and such because my NAT is "Strict". I've tried a whole bunch of port forwarding, turning of my Firewall, allowing DMZ for the Xbox's IP (I made it Static like portforward.com said and another guide) and so on.
But it's still strict. My modem (Speedstream 4200) is apparantly a router, aswell.. so i applied all the settings to that. And that connects to my router (D-Link DI-524) which i've applied all the settings.
Still fucking Strict- dumb piece of.. Tried turning UPnP on and off on both and nothing.
At one point the MTU test failed, so that pissed me off more. But i restarted them both and it worked again. Any idea's on this whole NAT bullshit?
Thanks.

item.title: Opening NAT
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

You said that it was open through modem. Did you have to change settings for this?

Read full topic

item.title: Opening NAT
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

I’ve opened all the ports, it’s just the double router thing.
You have to do all this stuff to assign only one router, too much hassel and i couldn’t be bothered.

Read full topic

item.title: Opening NAT
item.dc:creator: @kaza Kaza
item.description:
@kaza wrote:

I’m on a D-LINK router.

I created a new LAN IP on .20 then opened some ports. Google the ports that need opening. Mine went to open, but it changed back to moderate…

Read full topic

item.title: Opening NAT
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

All looks pretty complicated/annoying.
It’s not a huge problem, but it’s annoying when i want to join some friends.

NAT is open if i directly plug Xbox into the Modem, but then my brother can’t use wireless, so he gets pissed.
I don’t think i’ll bother.

Read full topic

item.title: Opening NAT
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

This is basically for Xbox Live- It all works fine, except connecting to other people and such because my NAT is “Strict”.
I’ve tried a whole bunch of port forwarding, turning of my Firewall, allowing DMZ for the Xbox’s IP (I made it Static like portforward.com said and another guide) and so on.

But it’s still strict.
My modem (Speedstream 4200) is apparantly a router, aswell… so i applied all the settings to that.
And that connects to my router (D-Link DI-524) which i’ve applied all the settings.

Still fucking Strict- dumb piece of…
Tried turning UPnP on and off on both and nothing.

At one point the MTU test failed, so that pissed me off more. But i restarted them both and it worked again.
Any idea’s on this whole NAT bullshit?

Thanks.

Read full topic
